Phylogeny of Hymenoptera
Project
View
Study subfamily Microgastrinae (Hymenoptera, Braconidae) in Iran: Taxonomic, faunistic, host associations, morphometric and diversity
Project
Microgastrinae wasps are hyper-diverse and can be collected in many different terrestrial habitats. A considerable number of species have been extensively used in successful biological pest control programs, making it one of the most important insect groups. This subfamily contains several super genera nevertheless remains poorly known in the Eastern Palaearctic regions especially country of Iran. The Iranian Microgastrinae fauna has until recently been poorly known, both taxonomically and biologically. In this study, we will focus on improving the faunistic, taxonomic, host association, morphometric and diversity studies in this territory.
